plants.name: Chrysanthemum morifolium
plants.description: Chrysanthemums are popular garden plants that bloom in late autumn, often used to brighten up gardens with their abundant, colorful flowers. They have a wide range of flower forms and colors.
plants.funFact: Chrysanthemums symbolize longevity and rejuvenation in many cultures and are the official flower of the city of Chicago.

plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub with glossy leaves and large, showy flowers that bloom in late autumn to winter. Widely cultivated in gardens, it thrives in mild climates.
plants.location: Eastern Asia, cultivated in temperate gardens globally
plants.funFact: Camellias were highly prized by Victorian gardeners and are the flower featured in Alexandre Dumas' novel 'The Lady of the Camellias'.

plants.name: Nerium oleander
plants.description: A hardy evergreen shrub that blooms profusely with funnel-shaped flowers mostly in warm climates, often extending into late autumn in mild areas.
plants.location: Mediterranean region, subtropical and tropical areas
plants.funFact: All parts of the oleander plant are toxic, yet it remains a popular ornamental plant in warm climate gardens.

plants.name: Protea cynaroides
plants.description: The national flower of South Africa, this striking plant features large, unique flower heads composed of many small flowers surrounded by colorful bracts, blooming during the late spring to early summer but, in its native habitat, can bloom intermittently into late autumn.
plants.funFact: The King Protea has one of the largest flower heads of any plant species in the world, and its name derives from the Greek god Proteus, who could change his form at will.
